oldest_week.brief_summary: Complete removal of wasm_of_ocaml backend (~32K lines), sourcemap improvements, and enhanced weak reference runtime
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Major architecture change removing wasm backend, improved sourcemap index support, and modernized runtime features
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Complete removal of wasm_of_ocaml backend** (~32,000 lines of WASM-related code deleted), transforming the project back to pure JavaScript compilation ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Enhanced sourcemap support** with index mapping for linking multiple JS files together, improving debugging capabilities ([1e54c94](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/1e54c943918016553ed2ba6cf75abe29596b8833), [a0a03bd](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/a0a03bd67ecdf83a86350b9e5b391ceb39c9cf72), [6f38333](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/6f38333b2e704a615afd7dca0aab101f68052f73))
- **Modern JavaScript runtime optimization** using static `Object.hasOwn` instead of dynamic property checks for better performance ([1bc3ab8](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/1bc3ab8cde58915a35b4f2af59fae9c27f8dc392))
- **Improved weak reference handling** with complete runtime reimplementation for better memory management ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Global dead code elimination regression tests** added to prevent future issues ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067), [ebc6c4c](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/ebc6c4c00ccfede2fff6890e2f9c81b8b91bf5a8))
oldest_week.activity_summary: Major architectural shift with extensive code removal and new feature request for Dom_html modernization
oldest_week.activity:
- **Complete architectural transformation** removing all WebAssembly compilation support in favor of pure JavaScript target, affecting compiler, runtime, and build systems ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Documentation rewrite** completely updating README from wasm_of_ocaml focus to comprehensive js_of_ocaml documentation with installation guides, feature descriptions, and data representation details ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Runtime system modernization** across multiple JavaScript modules including improvements to weak references, bigarray handling, and parsing functions ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
- **Build system cleanup** removing wasm-related build configurations, test suites, and GitHub workflow files while updating opam package specifications ([4cd7df4](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/commit/4cd7df45183ca6f590240eeb6f48c984fb925067))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Major simplification trend moving from dual JS/WASM targets to single JavaScript focus
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Backend consolidation strategy** with the project moving away from dual compilation targets (JavaScript + WebAssembly) to focus exclusively on JavaScript compilation, simplifying maintenance and development efforts
- **Modern JavaScript adoption** with runtime optimizations using current browser APIs like `Object.hasOwn` for improved performance and compatibility
- **Enhanced debugging capabilities** through improved sourcemap handling, particularly for complex linking scenarios involving multiple JavaScript files
oldest_week.contributors_summary: Limited activity with one feature request by Jérôme Vouillon and ongoing experimental work by hhugo
oldest_week.contributors:
- [Jérôme Vouillon](https://github.com/vouillon) opened feature request [#1719](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/issues/1719) for auditing and modernizing Dom_html module, focusing on updating mouse event properties from int to float and removing outdated Internet Explorer compatibility code
- [@hhugo](https://github.com/hhugo) continues experimental work on monomorphic representation for MlBytes in [#1229](https://github.com/ocsigen/js_of_ocaml/pull/1229), an ongoing draft PR from 2022 focused on runtime performance optimizations using deoptigate analysis

latest_week.brief_summary: Backend optimization surge with 10 x86 peephole PRs, type system improvements, and new intrinsics support
latest_week.new_features_summary: Manifest file support, 128-bit intrinsics, BMI/BMI2 ops, jkind normalization optimization, unboxed module elements
latest_week.new_features:
- **Manifest file support** for compiler include paths via `-I-manifest` and `-H-manifest` flags, allowing specification of available files directly rather than entire directories ([#4986](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4986))
- **128-bit integer arithmetic intrinsics** including `add_int128`, `sub_int128`, `mul_int64` (signed/unsigned), compiling to efficient add/adc, sub/sbb, and imul/mul instructions ([#5025](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5025))
- **BMI/BMI2 intrinsics implementation** with support for POPCNT, LZCNT (now separate from BMI), and multiple return registers in simdgen ([#5065](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5065))
- **Jkind normalization fuel optimization** - runs out of fuel only once per jkind, reusing fuel cache when normalizing with additional types ([#5047](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5047), [#5009](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5009))
- **Unboxed elements at module top-level** now allowed after fixing cross-module inlining behavior ([#5064](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5064))
- **Skip mode hints** added in several missing locations to improve mode error diagnostics ([#5053](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5053))
- **Chamelon minimization** can now be stopped with Ctrl-C by replacing `Sys.command` with Unix module calls ([#5061](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5061))
- **Race condition fix** for `-dump-dir` flag when used with nonexistent paths in parallel builds ([#5010](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5010))
- **Classic mode approximations** now track kinds for non-Value variables, enabling proper mixed module block inlining ([#5058](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5058))
- **Repository cleanup** - boot directory removed, saving 5% of source repo size ([#5067](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5067)); .vscode directory now ignored ([#4186](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4186))
- **Debugging improvements** with new tests for C/OCaml interaction including runtime breakpoints and stack traces ([#5062](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5062))
- **IRC register allocator refactoring** - `irc_work_list` moved from instruction field to IRC state table ([#4594](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4594))
latest_week.activity_summary: 26 new PRs opened including abstract kinds preparation, typed ARM64 DSL, and separability axis work; backend optimization continues
latest_week.activity:
- **New PRs opened** this week include abstract kinds preparation by [Chris Casinghino](https://github.com/ccasin) ([#5070](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5070)), typed ARM64 DSL by [Mark Shinwell](https://github.com/mshinwell) ([#5037](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5037)), separability axis scannable conversion by [Zack Eisbach](https://github.com/zackbach) ([#5031](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5031)), register allocation affinity support by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) ([#5059](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5059)), and x86 peephole optimizations continuation ([#5063](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5063))
- **Backend optimization surge** led by [Xavier Clerc](https://github.com/xclerc) with 10 merged PRs implementing x86 peephole rules for redundant comparison removal ([#5028](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5028)), MOV-to-LEA rewriting ([#5018](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5018)), MOV-to-XCHG optimization ([#5016](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5016)), useless move deletion ([#4985](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4985)), MOV chain optimization ([#4977](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4977)), infrastructure refactoring ([#5032](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5032), [#4975](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4975)), CI testing ([#4976](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4976)), and IRC refactoring ([#4594](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4594))
- **Type system evolution** with [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) optimizing jkind normalization fuel ([#5047](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5047), [#5009](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5009)) and environment fold operations ([#5066](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5066)), [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) re-enabling unboxed module elements ([#5064](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5064)), [Zesen Qian](https://github.com/riaqn) adding staticity checking ([#5054](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5054)) and mode hints ([#5053](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5053)), and [Vincent Laviron](https://github.com/lthls) fixing classic mode approximations ([#5058](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5058))
- **Intrinsics expansion** by [Max Slater](https://github.com/TheNumbat) adding 128-bit integer operations ([#5025](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5025)) and BMI/BMI2 support ([#5065](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5065))
- **Flambda2 cleanup** with [Basile Clément](https://github.com/bclement-ocp) removing 3-year-old disabled code age relation join ([#5051](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5051)) and improving chamelon ([#5061](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5061)), [Nathanaëlle Courant](https://github.com/Ekdohibs) refactoring reaper code ([#5049](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5049), [#5038](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5038))
- **Ongoing work** includes reaper type rewriting ([#5043](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5043)), GADT with-bounds re-enablement ([#5046](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5046)), typed ARM64 DSL ([#5037](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5037)), flambda2 type interface ([#5050](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5050)), debugging improvements by [Simon Spies](https://github.com/spiessimon) ([#4916](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4916), [#4961](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4961), [#4928](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4928)), name mangling scheme by [Tim McGilchrist](https://github.com/tmcgilchrist) ([#4850](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4850)), and untagged int arrays by [James Rayman](https://github.com/jra4) ([#4779](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4779), [#4643](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4643), [#4936](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4936))
- **Developer tooling improvements** including manifest files by [Andrei Odintsov](https://github.com/Forestryks) ([#4986](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/4986)), magic number bump by [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) ([#5048](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5048)), boot directory removal by [Jacob Van Buren](https://github.com/jvanburen) ([#5067](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5067)), test fix by [Vesa Karvonen](https://github.com/polytypic) ([#5042](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5042)), and documentation typo fix by [BuzzY_](https://github.com/BuzzYbis) ([#5069](https://github.com/oxcaml/oxcaml/issues/5069))
latest_week.trends_summary: Backend optimization focus, type system evolution, platform support expansion, and technical debt reduction
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Backend optimization momentum** with systematic x86 peephole work establishing patterns for instruction-level optimization including flag liveness analysis, pseudo-liveness tracking, and comprehensive CI testing
- **Type system maturation** through jkind normalization improvements, mode system refinements, and preparation for abstract kinds feature
- **Intrinsics library expansion** targeting both x86 (BMI/BMI2) and ARM64 platforms with focus on efficient compilation of low-level operations
- **Flambda2 consolidation** removing long-disabled features and refactoring for clarity while preparing for type rewriting capabilities
- **Developer experience focus** through repository cleanup (boot directory removal), tooling improvements (manifest files), and build system fixes
- **Cross-module optimization** work addressing mixed module blocks and classic mode approximation issues to improve inlining behavior
- **Platform parity efforts** with ongoing ARM64 DSL work and intrinsics additions to match x86 capabilities

latest_week.brief_summary: Merged OCaml 5.2.0minus-24 compiler changes and opened PR for jkind hover support
latest_week.new_features_summary: Added jkind hover expansion, SIMD float16 types, Runtime_metaprogramming extension, and fixed documentation lookup prioritization
latest_week.new_features:
- Added `Jkind.format_expanded` function to expand jkind abbreviations when hovering, enabling Merlin to show full expanded forms of jkind types rather than abbreviations ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- Fixed **documentation lookup bug** where `.cms` files were incorrectly prioritized over `.cmti` files, causing wrong documentation to be displayed for stdlib modules ([55ec2f4](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/55ec2f413cdb75c8eed72e8b8fa752a2ae6ab216))
- Added support for new **SIMD float16 vector types** including `float16x8`, `float16x16`, and `float16x32` variants (both boxed and unboxed) in `Predef` module ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- Added **Runtime_metaprogramming language extension** at Alpha maturity level, extending the set of experimental OCaml features available ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- Updated **magic numbers** from 569 to 570 for all compiler artifact formats (cmi, ast_intf, ast_impl, cmt, cms, and index) to match upstream compiler changes ([00e7d73](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/00e7d7311d0e7ec8f13129bf437e76451d9ce9bb))
- Enhanced `Load_path.get_visible` to return both directories and basenames via new `dirs_and_files` record type, supporting manifest file handling ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- Made type checking more **lazy** to improve performance when handling complex type signatures ([45b1502](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/commit/45b1502f64ce8581014c2534ca5b821929b39baf))
- Added **lazy variants** of environment lookup functions (`find_value_by_name_lazy`, `find_module_by_name_lazy`, `find_modtype_by_name_lazy`) to defer substitution work ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
- Introduced new `fold_modules_lazy` and `fold_modtypes_lazy` functions in `Env` module for efficient traversal of module structures ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201))
latest_week.activity_summary: Opened PR for jkind hover support; merged comprehensive OCaml 5.2.0minus-24 compiler update
latest_week.activity:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) **opened** [#200](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/200) to add **type hover support for jkinds**, enabling Merlin to display expanded jkind abbreviations when users hover over type expressions (opened November 21, updated this week)
- **Merged OCaml 5.2.0minus-24 compiler changes** into Merlin through [#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201) by [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923), synchronizing with upstream compiler including handling of new `-I-manifest` and `-H-manifest` parameters (determined unnecessary for Merlin after discussion with [Andrei Odintsov](https://github.com/Forestryks)), resolving conflicts from parameterized module changes, and fixing type errors introduced by lazy type representation improvements
- Addressed **breaking changes** from multiple upstream OCaml PRs including handling `.cms` file generation for stdlib (previously only `.cmt` files existed), requiring prioritization order changes from `.cmsi > .cms > .cmti > .cmt` to properly prioritize `.cmti` files for documentation
- Updated **mode system** and **closure lock** handling throughout the type checker, including refactored `add_escape_lock`, `add_share_lock`, and `add_closure_lock` functions with revised `Mode.Hint.pinpoint` parameters
- Enhanced **jkind subsumption checking** by adding `level` parameter to `Layout.sub` function for improved type level tracking during unification
- Improved **error reporting** functions in `Env` and `Jkind.Violation` modules by adding `level` parameter to `report_error`, `report_lookup_error`, `report_with_offender`, and related functions for better diagnostic context
- Refactored **type marking infrastructure** in `Btype` module, replacing `unmark_iterators` with more flexible `type_iterators` that take `type_mark` parameter, and adding distinction between `type_iterators_full` and `type_iterators_without_type_expr`
- Updated test suite across multiple files including `function-recovery.t`, `mode-recovery.t`, `parameters.t`, `type-enclosing`, and `typing-recovery.t` to reflect new compiler behavior
latest_week.trends_summary: Continued emphasis on lazy evaluation and performance optimization in type checking infrastructure
latest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Lazy type representation** becoming more prevalent throughout Merlin's codebase, with new `Subst.Lazy` module providing lazy variants of `value_description`, `module_declaration`, and `modtype_declaration` types to defer expensive substitution operations until needed
- **Jkind system maturation** continues with enhanced tooling support including hover capabilities and expanded formatting functions, making the advanced type system more accessible to developers
- **SIMD type support expansion** with addition of float16 variants completing the SIMD type coverage across different vector widths (128-bit, 256-bit, and 512-bit)
- **Mode system refinement** showing consolidation of various lock mechanisms (`escape_lock`, `share_lock`, `closure_lock`) under unified `Mode.Hint.pinpoint` abstraction for tracking mode constraints
- **Type-level performance optimization** through strategic laziness in type operations, visible in commits like "Make lazier" and the introduction of lazy lookup functions throughout the environment module
latest_week.contributors_summary: Liam Stevenson authored all commits and opened both PRs; dkalinichenko-js provided code review
latest_week.contributors:
- [Liam Stevenson](https://github.com/liam923) authored the comprehensive OCaml 5.2.0minus-24 merge through 23 commits ([#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201)), including conflict resolution, type error fixes, test updates, and documentation bug fixes, and opened the jkind hover support PR ([#200](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/200))
- [@dkalinichenko-js](https://github.com/dkalinichenko-js) provided code review feedback on [#201](https://github.com/oxcaml/merlin/issues/201), confirming changes looked good and asking clarifying questions about specific test changes
- [Andrei Odintsov](https://github.com/Forestryks) ([@Forestryks](https://github.com/Forestryks)) participated in discussions about `-I-manifest` and `-H-manifest` parameter handling, helping determine that Merlin doesn't need to understand these new flags

oldest_week.activity_summary: Single contributor focused on performance optimizations and platform consistency improvements
oldest_week.activity:

- **External dependency integration** with removal of internal `Countdown` implementation in favor of using version from `multicore-bench` library ([#316](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/316))
- **Experimental performance work** exploring CPU relaxation during yielding to reduce contention, though this approach was closed without merging after showing no measurable effect ([#303](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/picos/issues/303))

oldest_week.brief_summary: Fork action header exposed for external libraries and Windows symlink test improvements merged
oldest_week.new_features_summary: Made fork_action.h public header for external libraries and improved Windows symlink test compatibility
oldest_week.new_features:
- **Public header exposure** for `fork_action.h` enabling external libraries to provide new fork actions by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) ([#769](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/769))
- **Windows symlink test compatibility** check using `Unix.has_symlink()` to skip symlink tests on systems without support by [Onah_Anthony](https://github.com/create2000) ([#771](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/771))
oldest_week.activity_summary: New PRs opened for Process.pipe type relaxation and Windows test improvements, ongoing Windows compatibility work
oldest_week.activity:
- **New PRs opened** include Process.pipe type relaxation by [Isaac Arogbonlo](https://github.com/Arogbonlo) ([#767](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/767), [#770](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/770)) and Windows symlink test improvements by [Onah_Anthony](https://github.com/create2000) ([#766](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/766), [#768](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/768))
- **Windows compatibility** work continues with native implementation attempts by [Kento Okura](https://github.com/kentookura) ([#738](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/738)) and test suite enablement efforts ([#761](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/761))
- **Type system improvements** discussed around `Eio.Process.pipe` return types for better API compatibility with monomorphic types ([#750](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/750))
oldest_week.trends_summary: Focus on Windows compatibility and type system flexibility for better external library integration
oldest_week.emerging_trends:
- **Windows platform support** receiving increased attention with multiple contributors working on test compatibility ([#761](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/761), [#766](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/766), [#768](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/768), [#771](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/771), [#738](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/738))
- **External library integration** improvements with public header exposure for fork actions ([#769](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/769))
- **Type system flexibility** work to improve API compatibility between Eio and external libraries like Cohttp ([#750](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/750), [#767](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/767), [#770](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/770))
oldest_week.issues_summary: Three good first issues available covering Windows testing, chmod implementation, and Process.pipe type improvements
oldest_week.good_first_issues:
- **Windows test suite enablement** ([#761](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/761)) by [Thomas Leonard](https://github.com/talex5) with guidance on incrementally enabling MDX tests on Windows platform
- **Chmod support implementation** ([#764](https://github.com/ocaml-multicore/eio/issues/764)) by [Patrick Ferris](https://github.com/patricoferris) with existing foundation work available and interest from [@webbunivAdmin](https://github.com/webbunivAdmin)

oldest_week.contributors_summary: Patrick Ferris led development with merged PRs, Onah_Anthony contributed Windows test fixes, Isaac Arogbonlo worked on type system improvements
